OR
"Time for this game to end."

text:
"We've got your signal, recognition looks good.  Looks like things are going well on your end $playerName.  Clear skies."
OR
Unconcerned, sedate activity ensues as codes are checked and verified; the watch officer gives a jaunty salute.

"Beacon checks out, you're clear to proceed comrade; burn bright out there!"
OR
The SRA fleets communique is preceded by a markedly friendly sounding electronic chirp. "Secure codes check out; the cooperative authority sends their regards, Captain."

script: $ignorePlayerCommRequests = true 1
text:
The Yardie $personRank meets your gaze levelly for a few moments, before simply nodding curtly in acknowledgement and signaling $hisOrHer crew to their stations.  The comms signal cuts out a moment later.
OR
The SRA fleet meets your call with bravado, though you're unsure if the person on the other end is the fleet leader. 

"Hoping for our surrender then, are you? Piss off, we're tougher than you think you damn running dog!" The message is accompanied by a particularly rude gesture.

script: AddText "Lumen's small docking facilities echo with the boisterous noise of the dock crew, as a small number of merchants haggle in front of the tiny commodities exchange office.  Deeper in you can see coloful banners advertising a number of locally brewed drinks, an abiding passion of the locals." textGrayColor

AddText "Pirate crews carouse loudly as various captains of less than legal status strut throughout the Port Concourse or haggle energetically with the flunkies of the pirate currently in charge over their stolen goods. The entire place is thick with rogues, drawn in by the promise of easy pickings." textGrayColor

AddText "The monolithic presence of one of the Domain's ancient radiation absorbers looms over the Concourse, even at some tens of kilometers away, its tip lost in the leaden sky.  Traders meander here and there, meeting with the exotic looking locals while ignoring the steady drizzle." textGrayColor

AddText "Furtive groups of sullen rogues stalk across the cavernous docking bay dominating the dark side of this asteroid.  Despite being packed with ships and Pit Crews to service them, everything is eerily quiet, the steady hiss of air processors broken only occasionally by the distant sound of heavy machinery." textGrayColor

AddText "The docks are a riot of color and noise as cargoes are energetically off and onloaded.  An SRA official in a rather eye catching outfit waves you down to see if you need any help." textGrayColor

AddText "Euripides' extensive landing facilities are packed with a motley array of spacecraft; cantinas and small restaurants fill much of the free space in and around the Starport Concourse.  The scene is a riot of color and barely organized chaos, spacers of all walks hurrying to and fro on business beneath the distant peaks of Marions great arcologies." textGrayColor

AddText "The air of the extensive hangar facilities is thick with tension.  Yardie pit crews carry out maintenance on docked ships with uncharacteristic silence; the banners which once hung from the hangars back wall are gone now, replaced with boards filled with tallies and small memorials."  textGrayColor

text: The bar is typically Yardie, favoring a large communal open floor surrounded by low tables; the lighting is warm, broken by the occasional flash of garish neon. Draped banners of the local cooperatives cross the ceiling proudly. Servers in sparse, colorful garb dance between tables and small clusters of people, the buzz of conversation and music filling the space with a hum of energy.

text: "Hm. Funny. Obviously we are not going to accept your... generous offer of service. Do stick around though, Captain; the Security Service would love to say hello."

"Well, you're ballsy, I'll give you that but uh... no. Seeing as you're currently on commission by $theOtherCommissionFaction it would, at the very least, represent something of a security risk for us to enlist you in our reserves. Maybe if you resign your other commission first, we can talk. Until then, clear skies."
"I'm afraid we cannot accept your entry into our commissioned reserve forces, Captain. You do not currently meet our criteria for entry; clear skies $playerName."

"Yes, well, I see here that you're already reasonably well regarded by Fleet Coord, and our databases are clean, at least of anything sufficient to keep you from the Reserve. You pass, I suppose.

I'm certain you're expecting a spiel here, Captain, so I won't disappoint you. Accepting a commission with the SRA bears with it a number of responsibilities and requirements; you will be expected to fight to further secure our Coalition from its foes and, where possible, to advance the revolution. You may also be expected to smile for cameras and look silly in a dress uniform. It is a matter I advise you think seriously on before accepting.

You will, of course, have the right to resign your commission at any time, though it will likely damage your reputation with the Coordinators Office. Possibly even cause the Security Service to wonder if it made an error in trusting you with these responsibilities."
"So that's the song and dance out of the way. If you're still up for it I'll get your commission sorted out, and... well, then you'll be part of the Reserve Naval Force. Do you accept?"
"Glad to hear you're with us, Captain. Welcome to the SRA Reserves."
"$personRank $personLastName chats for a bit, giving a bit of clarification over the expectations you've taken on, but eventually has to break off the meeting in order to to deal with another issue."

"Yeah, I suppose it is a lot to ask of someone, isn't it? Don't worry about it Captain.

Is there anything else I can do for you?"

"If you're certain; we can't keep you and you'd be within your rights. Still there are those among our ranks who might feel a bit... jilted shall we say? And we really could use your help, still. So, again, are you really sure about this?"

"Well, so it goes. Thank you for your efforts on our behalf. And thank you for being willing to tender your resignation in person.\n\nIf you'll excuse me I have to register your separation from the Reserve. Clear skies, Captain."

"Glad to hear you've decided to stay with us. Sometimes it can difficult to keep going, I know, but the SRA is lucky to have people who can push through such difficulty and keep going. Clear skies, Captain."
